summary: This document consists of official count slips and inmate rosters from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 9-10, 2019. It includes a detailed inmate census and a specific roster showing inmates on suicide watch, providing administrative context for the facility's operations around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

events.title: Inmate Roster and Count at MCC New York
events.description: Administrative count and roster compilation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, showing a total inmate census of 758 and listing specific inmates with suicide watch assignments.

events.title: Official Out Count at MCC
events.description: Official out count conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, with inmates grouped by housing unit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York had an inmate census of 758 on August 9-10, 2019.
The facility's records show specific housing unit breakdowns (e.g., B-A: 26, C-A: 10, K-S: 137).
An inmate roster dated August 9, 2019, lists four inmates with 'SUICIDE R' (suicide risk) assignments in the hospital operation category.
The documents are official Bureau of Prisons administrative forms (Count Sheet, Out-Count Form, Inmate Roster).
These records provide procedural context for how the facility operated and tracked inmates, including those on special watch, during the period of Epstein's incarceration.
